item.title: RT by @JavaScriptDaily: TIL Prettier is considering making tabs the default in 3.0. This is huge â€” it would make an entire set of programming languages more accessible (if you're somehow still pro-spaces, read this comment to instantly convert), and, more importantly, vindicate my personal preferences
item.dc:creator: @Rich_Harris
item.description:
TIL Prettier is considering making tabs the default in 3.0. This is huge â€” it would make an entire set of programming languages more accessible (if you're somehow still pro-spaces, read this comment to instantly convert), and, more importantly, vindicate my personal preferences

item.title: R to @sindresorhus: Sindre notes in the thread: "I'm certain Node.js will have a [..] Web Worker API at some point (whether it's now or in 10 years). Same as I was certain Node.js would get fetch [..] My hope is [..] to attract some interest [..] so that it can happen sooner rather than later."
item.dc:creator: @JavaScriptDaily
item.description: Sindre notes in the thread: "I'm certain Node.js will have a [..] Web Worker API at some point (whether it's now or in 10 years). Same as I was certain Node.js would get fetch [..] My hope is [..] to attract some interest [..] so that it can happen sooner rather than later."

item.title:

item.title: R to @traversymedia: I see working for myself as being the most stable option. Working for someone else there's the chance of being laid off or shuffled about for spurious reasons, whereas I'm not going to mess myself about. Pros and cons though!
item.dc:creator: @JavaScriptDaily
item.description: I see working for myself as being the most stable option. Working for someone else there's the chance of being laid off or shuffled about for spurious reasons, whereas I'm not going to mess myself about. Pros and cons though!
